outcome_var: 1 if the group succeeds in respecting his contract towards the lender, otherwise 0
outcome_description: External Delinquency replicated the second stage of the repayment decision when the repayment was due
predictor_var: The average distance (in meter) between the member and the other group members
predictor_info: Used as a measure of peer monitoring
covariate_1: 1 if the group has regulations and internal laws to reach there
covariate_2: 1 if all group members have the same business
covariate_3: 1 if the group members visit each other
covariate_4: 1 if the member knows the other group members before the formation of the group
covariate_5: The length in number of year spent by the borrower in the same region
covariate_6: Length (in month) during which the borrower was member of his group to the deadline of the loan
covariate_7: 1: will to make pressure to incite repayment
covariate_8: 1 if the group rejects a borrower who wants to join it
covariate_9: 1 if the borrower and the leader of his group have the same age (+/-2 years)
covariate_10: 1 if all the group have the same sex
covariate_11: 1 if the borrower and the leader of his group have the same level of education
covariate_13: 1 if the group member is female
covariate_14: 1 if the borrower has at least 6 years of education
covariate_15: 1 if the group member is married
covariate_16: 1 if the group member has other sources of money
covariate_17: number of members in the group
covariate_18: 1 if the MFI puts at the disposal of borrowers non financial services
covariate_19: 1 if the borrower would have liked to borrow more than the assigned amount
covariate_20: 1 if the relation is very intimate, 0 elsewhere

outcome_var: 1 if the group leader indicates that at least one member has ever misused a loan
outcome_description: By misuse we mean that a member has used the loan for other purposes than he/she initially indicated when obtaining the loan. If misuse of loans is reported this may indicate moral hazard behavior of group members.
predictor_var: average distance (in meters) between the group member and the other members of the group
predictor_info: Used as a measure of peer monitoring
covariate_1: 1 if the group member regularly visits the other group members.
covariate_2: 1 if the group member knows the other group members before forming the group
covariate_3: 1 if the group member has ever been member of another group
covariate_4: monthly income of the group member (in Nakfas)
covariate_5: the value a group member attaches to having access to loans from the credit program in the future, rang- ing from 1 (= very high value) to 4 (= very low value)
covariate_6: 1 if all group members are of the same sex

outcome_var: 1 if group has average arrears of < 3 days per loan and no loans in arrears > 7 days
outcome_description: A group received a dummy variable equal to one if they were by FUNDAP's own criteria, a `problem-free' group. These groups had never been more than seven days late with any loan, and had average arrears of less than three days per loan.
predictor_var: Average distance in kilometers between members' businesses
predictor_info: Used as a measure of peer monitoring
covariate_1: 1 if group consists of either all men or all women.
covariate_2: Number of years members acquainted before group
covariate_3: 1 if all members say all were friends before group
covariate_4: 1 if members partake in joint social activities
covariate_5: 1 if willingness to pressure others to repay
covariate_6: 1 if members feel applying sanctions dif®cult
covariate_7: Number of members in borrowing group
covariate_8: 1 if state moral obligation to repay group loan
covariate_9: 1 if say repay to stay on good terms with group
covariate_10: 1 if members know weekly sales of other members
covariate_11: 1 if members engaged in same line of business
covariate_12: 1 if at least one member has other credit access
covariate_13: Number of months in term of group loan
covariate_14: Number of years since borrowing group took first group loan

outcome_var: 1 for group members that had unresolved repayment problems after due date
predictor_var: Distance (in KM) between major economic activities of group members
covariate_1: 1 if borrower knew other members’ activities
covariate_2: 1 if borrower thinks he/she joined its “optimum” group
covariate_5: 1 if repay only because of moral obligation
covariate_6: 1 if borrower feels asset confiscation/prison is worst penalty upon default (compared to subsequent social problems)
covariate_7: 1 if participated in networks (e.g., Equb, Edir, Tsebel, etc.) with one or more group members
covariate_8: 1 if other (informal) sources of credit exist

outcome_var: 1 = individual contributes in round x (given that a subject had a successful investment and had the opportunity to contribute)
outcome_description: The individuals who suffer a random shock based on their draw from the bag of balls cannot contribute to group loan repayment, so the group debt is split among those individuals whose projects succeed and decide to contribute
predictor_var: Mean distance to others homes in km
covariate_2: 1 when member had received a shock the period before (implying other members had covered for her)
covariate_3: 1 if subject contributed to repayment in preceding round
covariate_4: 1 if any other group members' projects failed in preceding round
covariate_5: Amount contributed by others in group in preceding round (measured in dram)
covariate_6: Num. of group members subject would loan to
covariate_7: Fraction of life lived in area
covariate_8: Fraction of Others in peer group

outcome_var: 1 if the sample borrower i completed repayment before the due date
outcome_description: borrowers are classified into two categories: those who have fully made their required loan repayments by the due date are classified as “repaid”, and those who have missed repayments are classified as “default”
predictor_var: The farthest distance from the respondent’s house to a peer’s house (km)
covariate_2: percentage of group members who are relatives
covariate_3: percentage of group members who have cooperative relationships with the respondent
covariate_4: percentage of group members who are from the same village
covariate_6: number of household members in the labor force
covariate_9: 1 if the return on the microloan investment can cover the principal and interest required to pay
covariate_12: 1 if the family owns off-farm businesses
covariate_13: number of household members working outside the home
covariate_14: 1 if the family encounters any negative shock, such as sickness or crop losses, or owning other debts during the period of the loan
covariate_15: number of outside loan opportunities besides RCCs
covariate_16: 1 if the borrower needs a loan from the RCCs in the near future
covariate_17: 1 if the RCCs are the respondent’s first choice for a loan
covariate_18: 1 if any family member is a village official

outcome_var: 1 if if any member of the group has defaulted in repayment in time
predictor_info: assume measured in m based on descriptives, but km based on effect estimate
covariate_1: 1 if credit officer visit the group regularly
covariate_2: 1 if borrowers belongs to urban area
covariate_4: 1 if borrowers caste are OBC or General
covariate_5: 1 if borrowers engaged in non-farm activity
covariate_6: yearly food expenditure of the household
covariate_8: 1 the borrowers get the loan from the programme below Rs. 10000
covariate_9: 1 the borrowers get the loan from the programme below Rs. 10000
